title: Image Content Overlay
reference-overview: The Image Content Overlay provides a consistent background on top of an image that will allow for a clear display of content. The content is more readable, and the filtered background still allows for some of the image to show through.
reference-usage:
The Image Content Overlay container is used when you want to display any type of content on top of a background image.

It is often used with the following components:

  • Hero Banner
  • Carousel
reference-details:
• The container has slightly rounded corners on the bottom left and right, and a larger rounded off corner in the upper left. The upper right corner is squared off.
  • The background of the container uses a light screen to create the consistent background for the text, but also to bring in some washed out color.
  • A 9px rule across the bottom of the container allows for the inclusion of a darker color.
  • The colors of both the bottom rule and the background filter are configurable, and any color from the Color Palette can be used.
reference-mobile:
• The text size will increase.
  • The Image Overlay Container will shrink or expand to fit the overall containing element, so on mobile the width will shrink to fit.
